intro: Barleria leandrii, commonly known as the blue barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or perennial herb, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long blooming period, which can last several months.
